page.title: 01Peat Moors South of Wedmore
page.content: All the south of block is on the Westhay Peat Moor just 5 mtrs above sea level. This area is drained by a system of deep Rhynes or ditches, pumps and sluices prevent flooding. Rhynes are the field boundaries. Intensive indusrial extracction of peat and its transportation has caused the roads which run north, south across the moor to deteriorate and subside to the extent that 6 from 8 are downgraded to green lane or 'road used as public path status'. The rest of this area is used for rough grazing of cattle and a little market gardening. The few inhabitants sell bags of peat from their garages. To the north the land rises sharply to 70 metres above sea level, with better pastures and a ribbon of development on the Wedmore 11Wells Road
